content: The "Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001" is also known as the Act. It aims to reduce estate tax rates. The "Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001" reduces estate tax rates by amending the Internal Revenue Code to compute the tax at 39.6 percent of the excess of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts over the total tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. Adjusted taxable gifts refer to taxable gifts made by the decedent after December 31, 1976, excluding gifts included in the gross estate. The Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001 amends the Internal Revenue Code to compute the tax at 39.6 percent of the excess of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts over the total tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. Adjusted taxable gifts exclude gifts included in the gross estate. The Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001 amends the Internal Revenue Code to compute the tax at 39.6 percent of the excess of the taxable estate and adjusted taxable gifts over the total tax paid on gifts made after December 31, 1976. The tax imposed by section 2501 for each calendar year is based on the sum of taxable gifts for that year and preceding periods, to be paid by the donor. Amendments made by this section apply to estates of decedents dying and gifts made after the enactment of the Act. The Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001 increases the unified credit against estate and gift taxes to an exclusion equivalent of $10,000,000, with an inflation adjustment of the credit. The Estate Tax Relief Act of 2001 amended the Internal Revenue Code to increase the applicable credit amount to $10,000,000, with an inflation adjustment provision for decedents dying or gifts made after 2001. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF ESTATE TAX BENEFIT FOR FAMILY-OWNED BUSINESS INTERESTS. Section 2057 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, relating to family-owned business interests, is repealed. Conforming amendments are made to sections 2031(c) and the table of sections for part IV of subchapter A of chapter 11. These amendments apply to estates of decedents dying and gifts made after the enactment of this Act.
